The statement “a vision for an integrated society in which nationalism unites people rather than divides them” directs my train of thought towards a blending of the theoretical ideologies of the “Canadian mosaic” and the “American melting pot.” The mosaic model is based on the belief that a country becomes stronger when immigrants bring their cultural diversity with them for all to learn from in a heterogeneous society. The melting pot model forwards the idea of combining foreign elements together into a homogeneous culture driven by fusion and assimilation. I believe both tracks hold problematic elements. The mosaic model can create distance between culturally differing peoples as cultural bonding processes are not required to function in society. The melting pot model primarily forwards a united identity in order to possess social capital, leaving less space for individual cultural practices and beliefs. I posit a further integrated society where nationalism unites will find a middle ground between the two aforementioned social practices.
